<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID-19
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/30/coronavirus-surges-us-states-fauci-warns-rough-days-ahead?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hope You Remember How to Flatten the Curve
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="USA" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTYxL2NvdmlkLTE5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It may be July, but we're getting distinct March vibes. Businesses are shutting down, Dr. Fauci’s warning of an alarming rise in cases, and the NBA playoffs are just weeks away. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Fauci speaks</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The nation's top infectious disease expert told a Senate committee the U.S. could see <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa/fauci-says-no-guarantee-u-s-will-have-effective-covid-19-vaccine-warns-spread-could-get-very-bad-idUSKBN2412TA?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">100,000 new cases</a> of COVID-19 daily if behaviors don't change. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Currently, the U.S. is reporting around 40,000 new cases a day, mainly across the South and the West.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>That figure has climbed sharply recently. The NYT </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/30/world/coronavirus-updates.html#link-52bf2aa4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">calculates</a></span><span> that the number of new cases has grown 80% in the past two weeks. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Deaths from COVID-19 are still going down, but that <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-30/fda-issues-vaccine-guidance-as-fauci-balances-hope-with-realism?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could change</a> as time goes on and hospital beds run on short supply. It's "going to be very disturbing, I guarantee you that," Fauci said about fatalities. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Limiting the spread</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Governments inside the U.S. and out have taken steps to keep the virus from spreading beyond hotspots. For the first time in months, the EU is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/30/americans-to-remain-barred-from-european-travel.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opening its borders</a> today to 15 countries...but visitors from the U.S. (and Brazil, Russia, and more) are not allowed because of their COVID-19 situation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut, states that "went through hell" early on in the pandemic, are not keen on going back. Yesterday, they <a href="https://www.nbcnewyork.com/news/local/future-of-nycs-indoor-dining-in-limbo-as-covid-cases-tied-to-bars-restaurants-surge-in-us/2491984/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doubled</a> their list of quarantine-restricted states to 16, and this week New Jersey pushed back its reopening of indoor dining.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Speaking of delaying reopening...that's the policy move du jour. Late Monday, Arizona followed recent moves by Florida and Texas in closing some businesses including bars, which Dr. Fauci <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/30/health/fauci-stop-going-to-bars-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said yesterday</a> are "really not good, really not good." Los Angeles has closed beaches and banned fireworks displays for the upcoming July 4 weekend.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>It's unclear what the spike in new cases means for the economy. While we could expect a <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/06/30/back-to-work-laid-off-coronavirus-spikes/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">second wave</a> of job losses, just yesterday Fed officials <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/feds-williams-economy-has-likely-seen-low-point-in-continuing-crisis-11593529592?mod=hp_lista_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">maintained</a> that the worst of the damage is over. What it all comes down to is how successfully we limit the spread of the virus. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/30/adidas-hr-exec-resigns-complaints-racism-company?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Karen Is Out at Adidas
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yes, an actual person named Karen. Adidas’s head of human resources, Karen Parkin, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/30/business/adidas-karen-parkin-resigns.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stepped down</a> yesterday after facing criticism for failing to address issues of racism and discrimination at the apparel company. “It has become clear to me that to unify the organization it would be better for me to retire and pave the way for change,” she said in a statement.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Parkin reportedly characterized racism as “noise” exclusive to North America and not something that affected the larger company, which is based in Germany. Evidence points otherwise. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last year, a NYT investigation showed Adidas </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/06/19/business/adidas-diversity-employees.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">courted</a></span><span> Black athletes, celebrities, and customers...yet did little to address the lack of diversity in its workforce and leadership.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Employees have accused Adidas of dismissing their complaints of racism and considering designs based on racist stereotypes and the Confederate flag.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When Adidas <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/09/employees-demand-companies-fight-racism?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> a social media post condemning racism during recent protests, Black employees were quick to tell the company to look in the mirror. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Adidas has promised to give $120 million to causes addressing racial inequality, fill 30% of new U.S. jobs with Black and Latinx workers, and create scholarships for Black students.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Parkin+reportedly+characterized+racism+as+%E2%80%9Cnoise%E2%80%9D+exclusive+to+North+America+and+not+something+that+affected+the+larger+company&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/30/adidas-hr-exec-resigns-complaints-racism-company&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JOBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/30/microsoft-announces-program-train-25m-workers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Microsoft Recruits a New Class of LinkedIn Heroes
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Slide on digitization of workforce" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTU5L3NsaWRlX29uX2RpZ2l0aXphdGlvbl9vZl93b3JrZm9yY2UucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Microsoft</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Microsoft <a href="https://blogs.microsoft.com/blog/2020/06/30/microsoft-launches-initiative-to-help-25-million-people-worldwide-acquire-the-digital-skills-needed-in-a-covid-19-economy/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> an initiative to train 25 million people around the world for digital jobs—or as they're called in the pandemic era, jobs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Participants will get free access to Microsoft, LinkedIn, and GitHub learning programs in addition to $15 certifications and tools to find open positions. The program will focus on funneling workers into in-demand roles poised for growth, including IT support, digital marketing, and graphic design.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Microsoft is backing the program with $20 million in grants for nonprofits, $5 million of which is earmarked for organizations serving communities of color in the U.S.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>While employers have been shelling out on parfait bars for the office, Microsoft says there's been a decline in corporate training. Which is why it's also launching a new app to help employers upskill their workers.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In recent weeks, other corporations including Bank of America and Walmart have </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsoft-aims-to-train-25-million-workers-free-in-2020-11593529201?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set aside</a></span><span> funding for job training and reskilling.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> While online learning platforms like Coursera have become increasingly popular, many businesses continue to lean on traditional degree programs or work experience when hiring.</p>

CLIMATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/30/democrats-unveil-plan-net-zero-emissions-2050?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Democrats Release Beach Read to Save Beaches
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We're going to assume the 547-page climate change plan House Democrats <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/06/30/democrats-unveil-sweeping-plan-to-tackle-climate-change-345503?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> yesterday isn't supposed to be printed out.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In addition to the goal of net-zero emissions by 2050, the plan includes...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Other deadlines,</strong></span><span> including eliminating pollution from cars (2035), power plants (2040), and new commercial/residential buildings (2030).</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Investment: </strong></span><span>Doubling public transportation funding and transitioning fossil fuel-dependent communities to other industries.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The plan also <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/29/climate/house-democrats-climate-plan.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">intertwines</a> climate policy with racial justice, calling for investments in communities of color disproportionately affected by climate change. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Get ready for a fight </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Climate proposals are quick start kindling on Capitol Hill, and not just between parties. If this is the most ambitious climate plan Democratic leaders have submitted...it's because they distanced themselves from the way more ambitious Green New Deal some in the party introduced last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Democrats will use tough climate policy as a sticking point against Republican candidates this election season. Republicans, who were left out of the report's creation, will counter with accusations of partisanship.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/30/goldman-sachs-projects-national-mask-mandate-save-5-gdp?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Wear a Mask, Save $1 Trillion
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In what sounds like a fun college research project but is actually a matter of critical national importance, Goldman Sachs tried putting a number on the effect of face masks on the U.S. economy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The results: </strong>A national policy requiring face coverings could <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/wearing-a-mask-to-halt-the-spread-of-coronavirus-has-a-big-impact-on-us-economic-growthand-goldman-has-done-the-math-2020-06-30?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">prevent a 5% hit</a> to national GDP, the bank's chief economist wrote. How? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mask mandate → more people wearing masks → fewer cases of COVID-19 → no need to close businesses again.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Goldman said mask-wearing could partially substitute for those closures, which it projects would knock 5% from GDP.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Mandates work.</strong> In its research, Goldman found that the share of people who say they "always" or "frequently" wear masks jumped by <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/30/goldman-sachs-says-a-national-mask-mandate-could-slash-infections-and-save-economy-from-a-5percent-hit.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">25 percentage points</a> in the 30 days following a state mask mandate. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Despite research showing masks help stop the spread of the virus, they've become a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/28/controversy-masks-threatens-us-pandemic-response?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">politicized</a> accessory. Sen. Lamar Alexander, a Republican, kicked off a hearing yesterday by asking President Trump to wear a mask to set an example.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Maybe he's thinking of the lions outside the New York Public Library, which were just outfitted with masks of their own.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront." class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small>Jonathan Blanc/New York Public Library</small></p>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What powers Morning Brew, you ask? </strong>Coffee and our wonderful brand partners. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eU.S. consumer confidence \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/913a8b436da14c07610acbffb18a77e5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eticked up\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in June along with reopenings, but remained below pre-COVID levels.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt may be July, but we're getting distinct March vibes. Businesses are shutting down, Dr. Fauci’s warning of an alarming rise in cases, and the NBA playoffs are just weeks away. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFauci speaks\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe nation's top infectious disease expert told a Senate committee the U.S. could see \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa/fauci-says-no-guarantee-u-s-will-have-effective-covid-19-vaccine-warns-spread-could-get-very-bad-idUSKBN2412TA?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e100,000 new cases\u003c/a\u003e of COVID-19 daily if behaviors don't change. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCurrently, the U.S. is reporting around 40,000 new cases a day, mainly across the South and the West.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThat figure has climbed sharply recently. The NYT \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/30/world/coronavirus-updates.html#link-52bf2aa4?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalculates\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that the number of new cases has grown 80% in the past two weeks. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDeaths from COVID-19 are still going down, but that \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-30/fda-issues-vaccine-guidance-as-fauci-balances-hope-with-realism?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecould change\u003c/a\u003e as time goes on and hospital beds run on short supply. It's \"going to be very disturbing, I guarantee you that,\" Fauci said about fatalities. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLimiting the spread\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGovernments inside the U.S. and out have taken steps to keep the virus from spreading beyond hotspots. For the first time in months, the EU is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/30/americans-to-remain-barred-from-european-travel.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopening its borders\u003c/a\u003e today to 15 countries...but visitors from the U.S. (and Brazil, Russia, and more) are not allowed because of their COVID-19 situation.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNew York, New Jersey, and Connecticut, states that \"went through hell\" early on in the pandemic, are not keen on going back. Yesterday, they \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnewyork.com/news/local/future-of-nycs-indoor-dining-in-limbo-as-covid-cases-tied-to-bars-restaurants-surge-in-us/2491984/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edoubled\u003c/a\u003e their list of quarantine-restricted states to 16, and this week New Jersey pushed back its reopening of indoor dining.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSpeaking of delaying reopening...that's the policy move du jour. Late Monday, Arizona followed recent moves by Florida and Texas in closing some businesses including bars, which Dr. Fauci \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/30/health/fauci-stop-going-to-bars-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid yesterday\u003c/a\u003e are \"really not good, really not good.\" Los Angeles has closed beaches and banned fireworks displays for the upcoming July 4 weekend.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eIt's unclear what the spike in new cases means for the economy. While we could expect a \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/06/30/back-to-work-laid-off-coronavirus-spikes/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esecond wave\u003c/a\u003e of job losses, just yesterday Fed officials \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/feds-williams-economy-has-likely-seen-low-point-in-continuing-crisis-11593529592?mod=hp_lista_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emaintained\u003c/a\u003e that the worst of the damage is over. What it all comes down to is how successfully we limit the spread of the virus. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" Adidas\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYes, an actual person named Karen. Adidas’s head of human resources, Karen Parkin, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/30/business/adidas-karen-parkin-resigns.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estepped down\u003c/a\u003e yesterday after facing criticism for failing to address issues of racism and discrimination at the apparel company. “It has become clear to me that to unify the organization it would be better for me to retire and pave the way for change,” she said in a statement.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eParkin reportedly characterized racism as “noise” exclusive to North America and not something that affected the larger company, which is based in Germany. Evidence points otherwise. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast year, a NYT investigation showed Adidas \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/06/19/business/adidas-diversity-employees.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecourted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Black athletes, celebrities, and customers...yet did little to address the lack of diversity in its workforce and leadership.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEmployees have accused Adidas of dismissing their complaints of racism and considering designs based on racist stereotypes and the Confederate flag.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen Adidas \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/09/employees-demand-companies-fight-racism?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e a social media post condemning racism during recent protests, Black employees were quick to tell the company to look in the mirror. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eAdidas has promised to give $120 million to causes addressing racial inequality, fill 30% of new U.S. jobs with Black and Latinx workers, and create scholarships for Black style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn what sounds like a fun college research project but is actually a matter of critical national importance, Goldman Sachs tried putting a number on the effect of face masks on the U.S. economy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe results: \u003c/strong\u003eA national policy requiring face coverings could \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/wearing-a-mask-to-halt-the-spread-of-coronavirus-has-a-big-impact-on-us-economic-growthand-goldman-has-done-the-math-2020-06-30?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprevent a 5% hit\u003c/a\u003e to national GDP, the bank's chief economist wrote. How? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMask mandate → more people wearing masks → fewer cases of COVID-19 → no need to close businesses again.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGoldman said mask-wearing could partially substitute for those closures, which it projects would knock 5% from GDP.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMandates work.\u003c/strong\u003e In its research, Goldman found that the share of people who say they \"always\" or \"frequently\" wear masks jumped by \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/30/goldman-sachs-says-a-national-mask-mandate-could-slash-infections-and-save-economy-from-a-5percent-hit.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e25 percentage points\u003c/a\u003e in the 30 days following a state mask mandate. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eDespite research showing masks help stop the spread of the virus, they've become a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/28/controversy-masks-threatens-us-pandemic-response?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epoliticized\u003c/a\u003e accessory. Sen. Lamar Alexander, a Republican, kicked off a hearing yesterday by asking President Trump to wear a mask to set an example.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMaybe he's thinking of the lions outside the New York Public Library, which were just outfitted with masks of their own.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\"
